message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with sentiment classification, which is a natural language processing task. Additionally, the paper proposes a deep learning approach to sentiment classification, which is a common research area in the field of computational linguistics. 

It could also belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as deep learning is a subfield of AI and the proposed approach utilizes attention mechanisms to integrate sentiment linguistic knowledge into the neural network. 

cs.LG (Machine Learning) is another likely sub-category as the paper proposes a deep learning approach for sentiment classification. 

cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is also a possible sub-category as sentiment classification is often used in information retrieval tasks such as sentiment analysis of product reviews. 

Finally, cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is a possible sub-category as the proposed approach utilizes neural networks for sentiment classification.
